page.title: 04St.Michael's Church, Colwich
page.content: The Chapel of St.Chad was built before 900AD while the De Colwyches lived here. The Nave and Chancel are said to be mediaevil. A Chapel of Ease of Colwich Church was built for the Third Lord Anson at Great Haywood. This is now St.Stephen's Church. A family vault for the Anson's can be found at St. Michael's behind panelling, entered through a trap door. The East Window commemorates Thomas, The First Earl of Lichfield. Charlotte Sparrow, founder of Colwich School, and James Trubshaw, a builder and civil engineer are also remembered here. Trubshaw is buried in the South Aisle. He worked on several local bridges, and his son Thomas designed St. Stephen's. The church has a Tower with clock and six working bells, which were installed in the mid seventeenth century.
